meanings.definition: An officer of the law in Spain and Spanish-speaking countries.
meanings.sent1: The alguazils patrolled the streets to ensure safety.
meanings.sent2: The alguazils were respected members of the community.
meanings.sent3: The alguazils stopped to help a lost kitten find its way home.
meanings.sent4: The alguazils were like guardians, watching over the town.
meanings.sent5: The bright uniforms of the alguazils made them easy to spot in the crowd.

meanings.sent1: The alguazils delivered important documents to the judge.
meanings.sent2: The alguazils announced the beginning of the court session.
meanings.sent3: The alguazils accidentally delivered a message to the wrong person.
meanings.sent4: The alguazils' swift delivery of news was crucial for the trial.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the alguazils' footsteps echoed through the courthouse.
